abstracts

Interface UnboundedStorageSpecification<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HasInvariant
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractQueue, AbstractQueueIntPair, Queue2Stack, Queue2StackIntPair, QueueShareStack, QueueShareStackIntPair, ReliableStack, UnreliableStack

    public interface UnboundedStorageSpecification<T>
extends HasInvariant
    A FIFO bounded queue of integers with a maximum number of elements that must be at least 1.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    J Paul Gibson

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • is_empty

        boolean is_empty()
        Returns:
        if the queue is empty, i.e. the number of elements in the queue is equal to 0.

      • get_size

        int get_size()
        Returns:
        the maximum number of elements that the queue can hold

      • push

        void push(T x)
        Parameters:
        x - is the value being pushed onto queue, and which will become the element on the queue that has been there for the shortest time

      • head

        T head()
       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns:
        head of queue, where the head is the element that has been in the queue for the longest time.
        Does not change the state of the queue
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if we try to read the head of an empty queue

      • pop

        void pop()
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        remove head of queue if it is not empty, where the head is the element that has been in the queue for the longest time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if we try to pop from an empty queue

      • displayFaultyResult

        void displayFaultyResult()
        Display the result of faulty probability of push(), pop() and head()

      • invariant

        boolean invariant()
        Specified by:
        invariant in interface HasInvariant
        Returns:
        if the queue is in a safe state and respects the specified requirements:
        • the number of elements in the queue is no bigger than the maximum specified
        • the maximum bound is a positive integer
